nodes.documentation:
@notice The LendingPool contract holds all of the tokens that lenders transfer into the protocol. It is the contract that lenders interact with to deposit and withdraw their tokens including interest. The LendingPool interacts with the Lenders contract to ensure token balances and interest owed is kept up to date.
@author develop@teller.finance
nodes.name: LendingPool

nodes.documentation:
@notice It checks the address is the Loans contract address.
@dev It throws a require error if parameter is not equal to loans contract address.
nodes.name: isLoan
deposit
withdraw
repay
liquidationPayment
createLoan
withdrawInterest

nodes.documentation:
@notice Update the current interest validator address.
@param newInterestValidator the new interest validator address.
nodes.name: setInterestValidator
initialize

nodes.documentation:
@notice It deposits a given amount of tokens to Compound only if the cToken is not empty.
@param amount amount to deposit.
nodes.name: _depositToCompoundIfSupported

nodes.documentation:
@notice It withdraws a given amount of tokens if the cToken is defined (not 0x0).
@param amount amount of tokens to withdraw.
nodes.name: _withdrawFromCompoundIfSupported

nodes.documentation:
@notice It tests whether cToken address is defined (not 0x0) or not.
@return true if the cToken address is not 0x0. Otherwise it returns false.
nodes.name: _isCTokenNotSupported
tokenTransfer
tokenTransferFrom
tTokenMint

The LendingPool interacts with the Lenders contract to ensure token balances and interest owed is kept up to date.
@author develop@teller.finance
nodes.name: LendingPool

nodes.documentation:
@notice It checks the address is the Loans contract address.
@dev It throws a require error if parameter is not equal to loans contract address.
nodes.name: isLoan
deposit

createLoan
withdrawInterest

nodes.documentation:

@param newInterestValidator the new interest validator address.
nodes.name: setInterestValidator
initialize

nodes.documentation:
@notice It deposits a given amount of tokens to Compound only if the cToken is not empty.
@param amount amount to deposit.
nodes.name: _depositToCompoundIfSupported

nodes.documentation:
@notice It withdraws a given amount of tokens if the cToken is defined (not 0x0).
@param amount amount of tokens to withdraw.
nodes.name: _withdrawFromCompoundIfSupported

nodes.documentation:
@notice It tests whether cToken address is defined (not 0x0) or not.
@return true if the cToken address is not 0x0. Otherwise it returns false.
nodes.name: _isCTokenNotSupported
tokenTransfer
tokenTransferFrom
tTokenMint

createLoan(uint256,address).details: This function only can be invoked by the LoansInterface implementation.It withdraws the lending tokens from Compound before transferring tokens to the borrower.

params.borrower: address which will receive the tokens.

deposit(uint256).details: the user must call ERC20.approve function previously.If the cToken is available (not 0x0), it deposits the lending token amount into Compound directly.

params.amount: of tokens to deposit in the pool.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: It throws a require error if the contract is already initialized.

params.interestValidatorAddress: Interest validator address. It can be 0x0.

initialized().return: true if contract is initialized. Otherwise it returns false.

params.liquidator: address used to liquidate the loan.

repay(uint256,address).details: This function can be called ONLY by the Loans contract.It requires a ERC20.approve call before calling it.It throws a require error if borrower called ERC20.approve function before calling it.

params.borrower: address that is repaying the loan.

withdraw(uint256).details: If the cToken is available (not 0x0), it withdraws the lending tokens from Compound before transferring the tokens to the holder.

withdrawInterest(uint256).details: It withdraws lending tokens from Compound before transferring the tokens to the lender.

createLoan(uint256,address).notice: Once the loan is created, it transfers the amount of tokens to the borrower.

deposit(uint256).notice: It allows users to deposit tokens into the pool.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.notice: It initializes the contract state variables.

initialized().notice: Gets if the contract is initialized.

liquidationPayment(uint256,address).notice: Once a loan is liquidated, it transfers tokens from the liquidator to the lending pool.

repay(uint256,address).notice: It allows a borrower repaying their loan.

setInterestValidator(address).notice: Update the current interest validator address.

withdraw(uint256).notice: It allows any tToken holder to burn their tToken tokens and withdraw their tokens.

withdrawInterest(uint256).notice: It allows the lenders to withdraw interest.

userdoc.notice: The LendingPool contract holds all of the tokens that lenders transfer into the protocol. It is the contract that lenders interact with to deposit and withdraw their tokens including interest. The LendingPool interacts with the Lenders contract to ensure token balances and interest owed is kept up to date.
